alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:51AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern York , the City of Poquoson, the City of Hampton and the City of Newport News through 1030 AM EDT... At 951 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Eustis, or near Newport News, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lee Hall around 955 AM EDT. Newport News and Denbigh around 1000 AM EDT. Patrick Henry Field around 1005 AM EDT. Seaford and Tabb around 1010 AM EDT. Hampton around 1015 AM EDT. Langley AFB around 1020 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Dare, Newport News Golf Course, Lackey, Langley View, Oyster Point, Oriana, Messick, Hornsbyville, Harris Grove and Yorktown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
